snippet: Egypt’s interim foreign minister sought to distance the new government’s policy on Syria from that of former President Mohamed Morsi, who helped make the country a hub for Syrian opposition groups.
abstract: Egypt’s interim foreign minister Nabil Fahmy indicates that new government will shift its policies from those of former Pres Mohamed Morsi, saying country will be less involved in Syria's civil war.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and ASMAA AL ZOHAIRY

lead_paragraph: Egypt’s interim foreign minister sought to distance the new government’s policy on Syria from that of former President Mohamed Morsi, who helped make the country a hub for Syrian opposition groups.

headline.main: Egypt to Take New Look at Syrian Ties
headline.print_headline: In a Shift After Morsi, Egypt Indicates It Will Be Less Involved in Syria’s Civil War

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
